did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: San José State University Archives Directories, Guides Handbooks Collection
did.abstract: The San José State University Archives Directories, Guides Handbooks, 1920-1997 (bulk 1941-1976) consists of handbooks and directories targeted to students, faculty and staff. The directories contain address and telephone lists of students, staff, and faculty. The handbooks, mostly produced for student usage, give a comprehensive view of University procedures, resources, and traditions. The records consist of printed materials, bound and unbound guides and handbooks, directories, and pamphlets. This collection is arranged into four series: Series I. Directories, 1921-1997 (bulk 1945-1981); Series II. Student Handbooks, 1923-1997 (bulk 1941-1967): Series III; Staff Reference Guides, 1962-1997 (bulk 1961-1978); Series IV. Miscellaneous, 1902-1979 (bulk 1934-1969).
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.langmaterial: Languages represented in the collection: English

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Copyright has been assigned to the San José State University Library Special Collections Archives. All requests for permission to publish or quote from manuscripts must be submitted in writing to the Director of Special Collections. Permission for publication is given on behalf of the Special Collections Archives as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission of the copyright holder, which must also be obtained by the reader. Copyright restrictions also apply to digital reproductions of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: San José State University Archives Directories, Guides Handbooks Collection, MSS-2010-05-04, San José State University Library Special Collections Archives.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collection processed by Stephanie Waslohn. Finding aid EAD encoded by Stephanie Waslohn. Reviewed by Danelle Moon.

acqinfo.head: Project Information
acqinfo.p: This finding aid was created as part of the Survey and Cataloging Project, a two-year San José State University Library grant project funded by the National Historical Publications and Records Commission. The project began in 2008. The Project Director is Danelle Moon. The Project Archivist is Erin Louthen.

bioghist.head: Organizational History
bioghist.p: In 1857 the San Francisco Board of Education established Minns' Evening Normal School for current and prospective teachers in the city. Named after its principal, George W. Minns, the institution was formally established as the first California State Normal School by the State Legislature in 1862. A decade later, the Legislature voted to move the Normal School to San José, and the school relocated to its new home on Washington Square prior to the fall term of 1872. After a fire destroyed the Normal School building in 1880, the Legislature authorized $200,000 to construct a new building on the same site. Completed in 1881, the building was commonly referred to as the Second State Normal School. After several names and curriculum changes, Minns' Normal School is now San José State University, offering more than 134 bachelor's and master's degrees with 110 concentrations, and is recognized as one of the top public universities granting such degrees in the West.

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.bibref: Gilbert, Benjamin F., and Burdick, Charles. Washington Square, 1857-1979: The History of San José State University. San José, California: San José State University, 1980.

Walsh, James P. San José State University: An Interpretive History, 1950-2000. San José, California: San José State University, 2003.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The San José State University Archives Directories, Guides Handbooks, 1920-1997 (bulk 1941-1976) consists of handbooks and directories targeted to students, faculty, and staff. The directories contain address and telephone lists of students, staff and faculty. The handbooks, mostly produced for student usage, give a comprehensive view of University procedures, resources, and traditions. The records consist of printed materials, bound and unbound guides and handbooks, directories, and pamphlets.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into four series: Series I. Directories, 1921-1997 (bulk 1945-1981): Series II. Student Handbooks, 1923-1997 (bulk 1941-1967): Series III. Staff Reference Guides, 1962-1997 (bulk 1961-1978); Series IV. Miscellaneous, 1902-1979 (bulk 1934-1969).

scopecontent.head: Series Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: The materials in this series include student telephone directories, the Blue Key also known as the Spartan Key, and faculty staff directories of varying size and formats.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are arranged alphabetically by format, and then chronologically within each folder.

did.unittitle: Student and Faculty Directories, Faculty Directory
Student and Faculty Directories, Departmental Telephone Directory
Faculty Directories, alphabetical edition Office and Department edition, New Faculty addendums, Report on shifts in Faculty and Staff, Student and Faculty Directories

scopecontent.head: Series Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: This series consists of handbooks that were distributed to the student body. Early examples include the Campus Compass and A Spartan from the Start. The handbooks describe school regulations, dress codes and provides come context for campus traditions, as well as maps documenting the locations of specific student spots. Also included in this series are pamphlets produced for current and prospective students on financial aid, student activities, and night school.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are arranged alphabetically by format, and then chronologically within each folder.

scopecontent.head: Series Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: This series consists of reference guides produced for SJSU staff and faculty. The guides provide information on human resources, contact information for departments, emergency safety information, as well as policies and procedures.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are arranged alphabetically by format, and then chronologically within each folder.

scopecontent.head: Series Scope and Content Summary
scopecontent.p: This series consists of miscellaneous directories, handbooks, programs, pamphlets and printed matter.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Files are arranged alphabetically by format, and then chronologically within each folder.
